content:
First off, the error message may be referring to the total number of recipients you're sending to, so if you send 10 messages / hour, but each message is sent to more than 30 recipients, you may be exceeding the server limits…

Second, this is a server issue, not a Thunderbird issue. The SMTP server, not Thunderbird, is blocking you for (presumably) having abused their sending policies. All Thunderbird is doing is telling you what the SMTP server is telling it…
creator: DavidGG

content:
Wouldn't it be great if someone had thought of this and mail clients such as Thunderbird included junk/spam filtering capabilities? :)

https://support.mozilla.org/kb/thunderbird-and-junk-spam-messages

content:
We're not in front of your computer to see what's happening. And even though I'm psychic, I cannot read your mind either. So you're gonna have to better describe the problem if you want anyone here to be able to help…

What does "I can't reply or write" mean? How does that inability manifest? Post a screenshot showing what it is that you're missing that you'd expect to be there.

The following article may help you identify the problem and maybe even solve it by yourself by just choosing the right view options that you appear to have accidentally changed:

https://support.mozilla.org/kb/getting-started-thunderbird-main-window-supernova
creator: DavidGG

content:
That's what IMAP is for. Set up your email account as IMAP in Thunderbird and both devices will be in sync as a result of both devices seeing the same mail that's stored on the server:

https://support.mozilla.org/kb/imap-synchronization https://support.mozilla.org/kb/difference-between-imap-and-pop3
creator: DavidGG
